value:
What can I leave for my sisters, not
as king but as their brother? Perhaps
I will find the answer at this festival.

The people of Macedon must desire
to welcome the coming of spring
as well...

This is the first time I have ever
been surrounded by children.$k$pIt is more burdensome than being
surrounded by soldiers...

Do not misunderstand. I am only
taking part in this buffoonery at the
request of Minerva and Maria.

What is this? It does not seem to
be a wyvern egg, but what a curious
color it has...

I have something to deliver to you
from $Nf...$k$pThis attire is for the spring festival.
Do not inquire any further.

Thought you could attack while my
attention was diverted by the festival,
did you? Fool!

How absurd to think I would ever
let my guard down, even while at
a festival.

It feels as though this garb is
dulling my wit...

If I desire something, I need only take
it. However, I am not so tactless as to
refuse a festival gift.

I am Michalis, king of Macedon. What
reason could Minerva have to invite
me to such a festival?

The people of Macedon live in a
harsh environment where they must
support each other through battle.$k$pBut the days of fighting are not
meant to continue in perpetuity.$k$pAt conflict's end, days of fulfillment
and abundance await them. With that
hope do we continue the struggle.$k$pHow will it feel when those days
finally come to pass? The answer
may depend on who you ask.$k$pHowever, this country's festival gives
me a glimpse of what Macedon must
continue to strive for.$k$pI imagine that my realizing this is why
Minerva and Maria must have invited
me here. If so...$k$pI must give my utmost devotion to
Macedon so I may meet my sisters'
expectations for our people.
Rouse yourself, fool.
Dreaming, are we?
No more talk.
Spring is here!
Springtime fun...
I do not understand this fanciful costume. Explain your thinking.
Hm? You presume you may be so casual with me because of these festivities? You may not.
Minerva is quite insistent that I join in the festivalâ€”for Maria.
Studying the customs of other cultures can yield valuable insights.
When my sisters were young, I would cavort with them in springtime fields like these...
The chance to see my sister so happy is no bad thing.
And here I had hoped to see you don some inane costume.
It shall be so.
At your command.
No respite.
